<line: 40> of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to.
<line: 41> the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984..

[TEXT]
<line: 43>  The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)

[TEXT]

<line: 46>  is

[TEXT]
<line: 49> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence,
<line: 50> or mailing address until all fines, restitution
<line: 51> costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay restitution,
<line: 52> the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

<line: 19> total term of:

[TITLE]
<line: 21> 30 MONTHS

<line: 24> THE COURT RECOMMENDS VOCATIONAL TRAINING AND IMPRISONMENT AS CLOSE TO PHILADELPHIA, PA
<line: 25> AS POSSIBLE.

<line: 27> 0

<line: 5> (Rev. 06/05) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 6> Sheet 3 --- Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 8> Judgment-Page
<line: 9> Of

[TITLE]
<line: 11> DEFENDANT:
<line: 12> ENRIQUE HERNANDEZ
<line: 13> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 14> DPAE2:11CR000202-001
<line: 15> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of :

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 3 YEARS.

[TEXT]
<line: 21> The defendant must report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant is released within 72 hours of release from the.
<line: 22> custody of the Bureau of Prisons.

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant shall not commit another federal, state or local crime.

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled
<line: 27> substance. The defendant shall submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests.
<line: 28> thereafter, as determined by the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 30> The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that the defendant poses a low risk of
<line: 31> future substance abuse. (Check, if applicable.).
<line: 32> x
<line: 33> The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon.
<line: 34> X
<line: 35> The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (Check, if applicable.).
<line: 36>  The defendant shall register with the state sex offender registration agency in the state where the defendant resides, works, or is a
<line: 37> student, as directed by the probation officer. (Check, if applicable.)
<line: 38>  The defendant shall participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 40> If this judgment imposes a fine or restitution, it is a condition of supervised release that the defendant pay in accordance with the
<line: 41> Schedule of Payments sheet of this judgment.

[TEXT]
<line: 43> The defendant must comply with the standard conditionsthat have been adopted by this court as well as with any additional conditions
<line: 44> on the attached page.

[TITLE]
<line: 46> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 48> 1)
<line: 49>  the defendant shall not leave the judicial district without the permission of the court or probation officer;.
<line: 50> 2)
<line: 51>  the defendant shall report to the probation officer and shall submit a truthful and complete written report within the first five days of
<line: 52> each month;
<line: 53> 3)
<line: 54>  the defendant shall answer truthfully all inquiries by the probation officer and follow the instructions of the probation officer;.
<line: 55> 4)
<line: 56>  the defendant shall support his or her dependents and meet other family responsibilities;
<line: 57> 5)
<line: 58>  the defendant shall work regularly at a lawful occupation, unless excused by the probation officer for schooling, training, or other.
<line: 59> acceptable reasons;
<line: 60> 6)
<line: 61> the defendant shall notify the probation officer at least ten days prior to any change in residence or employment;
<line: 62> 7)
<line: 63> the defendant shall refrain from excessive use of alcohol and shall not purchase, possess, use, distribute, or administer any
<line: 64> controlled substance or any paraphernalia related to any controlled substances, except as prescribed by a physician;.
<line: 65> 8)
<line: 66> the defendant shall not frequent places where controlled substances are illegally sold, used, distributed, or administered;
<line: 67> 9)
<line: 68> the defendant shall not associate with any persons engaged incriminal activity and shall not associate with any person convicted of a
<line: 69> felony, unless granted permission to do so by the probation officer;
<line: 70> 10)
<line: 71>  the defendant shall permit a probation officer to visit him or her at any time at home or elsewhere and shall permit confiscation of any
<line: 72> contraband observed in plain view of the probation officer;.
<line: 73> 11)
<line: 74>  the defendant shall notify the probation officer within seventy-two hours of being arrested by a law enforcement officer;
<line: 75> 12)
<line: 76> the defendant shall not enter into any agreement to act as an informer or a special agent of a law enforcement agency without the
<line: 77> permission of the court; and
<line: 78> 13)
<line: 79>  as directed by the probation officer, the defendant shall notify third parties of risks that may be occasioned by the defendant's criminal
<line: 80> record or personal history or characteristics and shall permit the probation officer to make such notifications and to confirm the
<line: 81> defendant's compliance with such notification requirement..

[ABANDON]

[TITLE]
<line: 17> ADDITIONAL SUPERVISED RELEASE TERMS

[TEXT]
<line: 19> THE DEFENDANT SHALL REFRAIN FROM THE ILLEGAL POSSESSION AND/OR USE OF DRUGS AND SHALL
<line: 20> SUBMIT TO URINALYSIS OR OTHER FORMS OF TESTING TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. IT IS FURTHERS
<line: 21> ORDERED THAT THE DEFENDANT SHALL SUBMIT TO DRUG TREATMENT AS APPROVED BY THE COURT
<line: 22> AFTER RECEIVING A RECOMMENDATION BY THE U.S. PROBATION OFFICE. THE DEFENDANT SHALL
<line: 23> ABIDE BY THE RULES OF ANY PROGRAM AND SHALL REMAIN IN TREATMENT UNTIL SATISFACTORILY
<line: 24> DISCHARGED WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE COURT.

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]

<line: 19> $ 0

[TEXT]
<line: 21> Fine
<line: 22> $ 1,000.00

<line: 25> TOTALS
<line: 26> $ 100.00

[TEXT]
<line: 28>  The determination of restitution is deferred until.
<line: 29> . An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (AO245C) will be entered.
<line: 30> after such determination..

[TEXT]
<line: 32>  The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below..

[TEXT]
<line: 34> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in
<line: 35> the priority order or percentage payment column below. However, pursuant to 18 U.s.C. s 3664(i), all nonfederal victims must be paid
<line: 36> before the United States is paid.

[ABANDON]
<line: 38> Restitution Ordered

[ABANDON]
<line: 40> Total Loss*

[ABANDON]
<line: 42> Priority or Percentage.

[TITLE]
<line: 44> Name of Payee

[ABANDON]

[ABANDON]
<line: 47> TOTALS

[TEXT]
<line: 49>  Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement $

[TEXT]
<line: 51>  The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before the.
<line: 52> fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(f). All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be subject.
<line: 53> to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. $ 3612(g)..

[TEXT]
<line: 55> X
<line: 56>  The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:.

[TEXT]

<line: 60>   fine  restitution is modified as follows:

<line: 62> * Findings for the total amount of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or after
<line: 63> September 13, 1994, but before April 23, 1996.

<line: 15> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties are due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 19>  Lump sum payment of $
<line: 20> 100.00
<line: 21> due immediately, balance due.
<line: 22> A
<line: 23> X
<line: 24>  not later than
<line: 25> , or
<line: 26> X
<line: 27>  in accordance
<line: 28>  c,
<line: 29>  D,
<line: 30> E,or
<line: 31> X F below; or
<line: 32> B
<line: 33>  Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 34> C,
<line: 35>  D, or
<line: 36>  F below); or
<line: 37> c
<line: 38>  Payment in equal
<line: 39> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 40> over a period of
<line: 41> 0
<line: 42> (e.g., months or years), to commence.
<line: 43> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; or
<line: 44>  Payment in equal
<line: 45> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 46> over a period of
<line: 47> D
<line: 48> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 49> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 50> term of supervision; or
<line: 51>  Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within
<line: 52> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from
<line: 53> E
<line: 54> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time; or.
<line: 55> F
<line: 56> X
<line: 57>  Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:.
<line: 58> THE SPECIAL ASSESSMENT IS DUE IMMEDIATELY
<line: 59> THE FINE IS DUE IMMEDIATELY. IT IS RECOMMENDED
<line: 60> THAT THE DEFENDANT PARTICIPATE IN THE FEDERAL BUREAU OF PRISONS INMATE RESPONSIBILITY
<line: 61> PROGRAM AND PROVIDE A PAYMENT OF $25.00 PER QUARTER FROM MONEY EARNED IN PRISON TOWARDS
<line: 62> THE FINE. IN THE EVENT THE FINE IS NOT PAID PRIOR TO THE COMMENCEMENT OF SUPERVISION, THE
<line: 63> DEFENDANT SHALL SATISFY THE AMOUNT DUE IN MONTHLY INSTALLMENTS OF NOT LESS THAN'$5O.OO TO
<line: 64> COMMENCE 30 DAYS AFTER RELEASE FROM CONFINEMENT.

[TEXT]
<line: 66> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due during
<line: 67> imprisonment. All criminal monetary penalties, except those payments made through the Federal Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financial.
<line: 68> Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of'the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 70> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed..

[TEXT]
<line: 72> Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,
<line: 73> and corresponding payee, if appropriate.

[TEXT]
<line: 75>  The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution.
<line: 76>  The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):
<line: 77>  The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:.

[TEXT]
<line: 79> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal,.
<line: 80> (5) fine interest, (6) 'community restitution, (7) penalties, and (8) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs..
